diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Myopathy with skeletal asymmetry and hemidiaphragm elevation due to myotubularin mutations
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis is supported by clinical presentation of asymmetric weakness, skeletal asymmetry, and elevated hemidiaphragm discovered through chest radiographs, along with genetic analysis demonstrating mutations in the MTM1 gene in both families. The examination findings such as preserved deep tendon reflexes and the myopathic pattern on electromyography further indicate myopathy.
